alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Franklin; Nash; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 7:37PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Nash, southwestern Edgecombe, Wilson and south central Franklin Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 737 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bailey, or 13 miles southwest of Nashville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Wilson, Elm City, Bailey, Sharpsburg, Spring Hope, Middlesex, Saratoga, Sims and Pilot. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
